groundnut_early_leaf_spot_1.treatment: Remove and destroy infected crop debris. Practice crop rotation with non-legumes. Apply fungicides like Chlorothalonil or Mancozeb at the first sign of disease.

groundnut_early_rust_1.treatment: Use resistant varieties if available. Remove volunteer groundnut plants. Avoid overhead irrigation.
groundnut_early_rust_1.pesticide: Spray Tridemorph 80 EC @ 0.5 ml/l or Mancozeb 75 WP @ 2 g/l.

groundnut_healthy_leaf_1.treatment: No treatment needed. Maintain good agricultural practices.

groundnut_late_leaf_spot_1.treatment: Deep plowing to bury infected debris. Crop rotation. Early planting can sometimes escape severe infection.
groundnut_late_leaf_spot_1.pesticide: Spray Carbendazim 50 WP @ 1g/l or Hexaconazole 5 EC @ 1ml/l.

groundnut_nutrition_deficiency_1.treatment: Identify specific nutrient missing (often Nitrogen, Iron, or Zinc). Apply appropriate fertilizer or foliar spray.

groundnut_rust_1.treatment: Destroy infected plant debris. Crop rotation. Use rust-resistant cultivars.

soyabean_Bacterial_Pustule.treatment: Plant resistant varieties. Avoid cultivation when foliage is wet. Crop rotation.
soyabean_Bacterial_Pustule.pesticide: Copper-based fungicides can reduce spread but are not curative.

soyabean_Frogeye_Leaf_Spot.treatment: Tillage to bury residue. Crop rotation with corn or cotton. Use pathogen-free seed.

soyabean_Healty.treatment: Keep monitoring for pests and diseases.

soyabean_Rust.treatment: Monitor sentinel plots. Apply fungicide immediately upon detection.

soyabean_Sudden_Death_Syndrome.treatment: Select resistant varieties. Improve soil drainage. Delay planting slightly.
soyabean_Sudden_Death_Syndrome.pesticide: Seed treatments like Fluopyram (ILeVO) can help.

soyabean_Yellow_Mosaic.treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants (roguing). Control whitefly vectors.
soyabean_Yellow_Mosaic.pesticide: Control Whitefly with Thiamethoxam 25 WG @ 0.2g/l or Imidacloprid.

sunflower_Downy_mildew.treatment: Use resistant hybrids. Seed treatment is crucial. Avoid waterlogging.

sunflower_Gray_mold.treatment: Avoid excessive nitrogen. Control head moth larvae which predispose plants to rot. Reduce planting density.

sunflower_Leaf_scars.treatment: Physical damage or old injury. Monitor for secondary infections.
sunflower_Leaf_scars.pesticide: None usually required unless secondary infection occurs.
